free: #e No...we worked in the past. Let’s tell him we used to work every day.
#c 不是...我們以前工作。我們來跟他說我們以前每天工作。
#e In the past.
#c 過去的時候。
#e In the past, we worked every day, and we did not take a rest.
#c 從前我們每天工作，而且我們不休息。
#e And we went to work. On our way back, we carried woods on our back.
#c 而且我們去工作，回來的時候，我們又背木材。
#e We carried children on our back as well, carrying children there on the woord
#c 我們還要背小孩，小孩背在那裡，在木材上。
#e We came home and we made fire.
#c 我們回家，又要生火。
#e And then we boil water and cooked rice. We bathed the children.
#c (然後)我們煮洗澡水和煮飯。我們給小孩洗澡。
#n ga taqi ka heya「他正在睡覺」。
#e Yes, children went to sleep, and before that we fed children first. Then children slept.
#c 是這樣，小孩去睡覺，之前，我們給小孩子餵飯。然後小孩睡覺。
#e It was like that hard. That was our experience in the past.
#c 就是像那樣辛苦。那就是從前的經歷。
#e Robo, that thing.
#c Robo，那件事。
#e We often exchanged labors in the past.
#c 我們以前常常會交換工作。
#n smbarux還工；sntuku pila賺錢；sntuku借工。
#e We often sheared lemon grass in return.
#c 我們常常割香茅草還工。
#e Many people helped each other shear lemon grass.
#c 很多人互相幫忙收割香茅草。
#n hbaro用在很多人的情況。
#e Robo, how could we do that at that time?
#c Robo，我們那時候怎麼能那樣？
#e We walked on slopes. We could not take a car, and the road was lousy.
#c 我們走上坡路。我們沒辦法搭車，路又很糟。
#e That was really not easy.
#c 那真的不簡單。
#e There were no shoes in the past, either
#c 以前也沒有鞋子。
#e We went to work barefoot.
#c 我們赤腳去工作。
#e That was even farther in the past.
#c 那是更早以前。
#e Only lemon grass was a little..., so we grew cassavas afterwards.
#c 只有香茅草一點點那個，所以之後我們就種木薯。
#e We worked as hard as possible so as to earn children’s allowance. We could only harvest cassavas once in two years.
#c 為了孩子的花費，我們努力工作。木薯每兩年才收成一次。
#e Let children study.
#c 讓孩子念書。
#e We really had no money. To let children study at school, we dug (the cassavas) in only one year.
#c 真的我們沒有錢。為了讓小孩去學校讀書，我們一年就挖了。
#e Digging cassavas was toilsome.
#c 挖木薯很辛苦。
#ma的標記不確定。
#e Yes, we dug cassavas and then sun-dried them first. And sold them to register children at school.
#c 是，我們挖木薯，然後先曬乾。然後賣掉讓小孩學校註冊。
#e We made effort. We didn’t have and we borrowed it in advance.
#c 我們很努力。我們沒有，我們先借。
#n 這裡是指沒有錢。
#e How could we live that way at that time?
#c 我們當時怎麼能那樣生活？
#n 口誤。
#e Now I think.
#c 我現在想起來。
#e Now I think, “What was wrong in the past?” We exchanged labors. We did not buy pork and only ate salty fish. Why didn’t you buy pork?
#c 我現在想：「我們以前怎麼回事？」我們換工，也不買豬肉，只吃鹹魚。為什麼你不買豬肉？
#e We only ate salty fish.
#c 我們只有吃鹹魚。
#e We could not buy pork in the past.
#c 我們以前不知道要吃豬肉。
#e We did not buy pork before.
#c 我們之前不買豬肉。
#n tumun原意「圓圓的」。
#e Tumun said we were like fermented soy beans.
#c Tumun說我們就像豆豉。
#e Tumun, who was from Baisurin, said, “I know who does not eat pork,” because he was Southern Min.
#c Baisurin的Tumun說：「我知道沒吃豬肉的人。」因為他自己是閩南人。
#n kmukan也可以稱klmukan、plmukan。
#e If you don’t eat pork, the face will be shriveled.
#c 如果你沒吃豬肉，臉會乾癟。
#e “You Seediq people’s face is dry, because you do not eat pork,” Tumun said.
#c 「你們賽德克人不吃豬肉，所以臉很乾。」Tumun說。
#e That’s true. The faces of those who did not eat pork were dry.
#c 真的，沒吃豬肉的臉就乾乾的。
#e We did not know to buy pork.
#c 我們從前不知道要買豬肉。
#e We could only cook soup with chayote.
#c 我們只好拿佛手柑煮湯。
#n begu湯；ps-begu煮湯。
